paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philonthus
Stephens 1829a : 23
, attributed to Leach. Type species:
Staphylinus splendens Fabricius, 1792
, designated by Curtis (1836: pl. 610) . Notes: also
Stephens (1829b : 279
, 1832: 226),
Curtis (1829: 25)
,
Dillwyn (1829: 68)
;
Bouchard et al. (2011)
use Curtis (1829) as author.

=
Spatulonthus
Tottenham 1955 : 154
(as subgenus of
Philonthus
). Type species:
Philonthus longicornis Stephens, 1832
, by original designation. Note: as valid genus,
Coiffait & Sáiz (1968: 360)
; as synonym (not subgenus) of
Philonthus ,
Smetana (1995: 51)
.

=
Endeius
Coiffait & Sáiz 1968 : 355
. Type species:
Endeius loensis Coiffait & Sáiz, 1968
, by original designation. Distribution: Chile , Argentina , Juan Fernandez Is., Peru , Galapagos Is. Notes: revised (Chani-Posse de Maus 2008 ); as synonym of
Philonthus
, one species moved to Philonthina incertae sedis (Chani-Posse 2013: 404).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes: The global genus
Philonthus
, with 1326 species currently known, is the fourth largest genus within Staphylinidae and the largest within Staphylininae (Newton unpublished database). The Neotropical region accounts for 189 species and most of them (160 spp.) are endemic species. The large number of
Philonthus
species to be studied has been a challenging factor to achieve a modern concept of the genus, which has been
